intro: Leontodon glaucanthus, commonly known as the glaucous leontodon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers with a distinctive white or pale yellow center. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has basal leaves that are narrow and linear, and its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a relatively rare species in many regions.
